main event: A bright light was observed moving south over Big Bend National Park, Texas on April 20, 1964.
interesting points: The object appeared as a stationary light, similar to a star, but then disappeared behind a mountain peak.
The object was observed moving to the south at an elevation of around 15 degrees.
The report notes that the object had characteristics similar to a satellite, but the duration of the sighting was longer than expected for a satellite.
The observer was unsure if they had accurately estimated the duration of the sighting.
The report concludes that the observed object was likely the ECHO II satellite.
